definition: to hide (as an undercover agent)/an insider (in a gang of thieves)/a mole
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base

sentences.english: The man was an undercover deputy from Iredell County Sheriff's Office.
sentences.chinese: 這名男子是愛戴爾郡警局的臥底警員。

sentences.english: Ford, who spent years undercover, has two golden rules to help agents keep from getting their cover blown.
sentences.chinese: 福特做過幾年的臥底，有兩條鐵律使他不至暴露。

sentences.english: Being short of inculpation legalizes the criminal offence of secret policemen in criminal investigation.
sentences.chinese: 臥底警察在偵查中的犯罪行爲合法化，不具有可罰性。

sentences.english: It's fun that spies like you prefer to meet at the roof.
sentences.chinese: 你們這些臥底石真有意思，老在天台見面。

sentences.english: To investigate, he becomes an undercover agent at the waste disposal station.
sentences.chinese: 爲調查清楚，麥小龍臥底垃圾處理站。

sentences.english: Discourage gossip, and don't put people in the position of spying or reporting on each other.
sentences.chinese: 制止流言蜚語，不要讓人做臥底或者打小報告。

sentences.english: Swanson persuaded Hubley to work undercover to capture the killer .
sentences.chinese: 斯旺森說服赫布利去做臥底以便將兇手抓獲。

sentences.english: Robot fish could one day be enlisted for undercover science missions.
sentences.chinese: 機器魚有一天，被徵集服現役臥底科學任務。

sentences.english: “Thank you, ” The two spies of Israel said, very gratefully.
sentences.chinese: “非常感謝，”這兩個臥底向我致意誠摯的謝意。

definition: bunch of gangsters/criminal gang/organized crime syndicate
well qualified/competent/to be equal to the task/able to do sth very well
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
cast and crew/performers and production team
